review: It is nice to have access to the movies.  Streaming uses our internet data usage quickly so we have had to up that usage which is costing about $25 more a month.  We were trying the Fire Stick so we could decrease our Direct TV bill, but as you can see that might be a wash.  We are still experimenting, although we find the movie channels on Direct TV don't have much to watch on a regular basis so the Fire Stick does give a lot more options.  We are finding some of the movies we want to watch on the Stick can not be streamed, but to rent them is cheaper than Pay per view.
author: schrek

review: Worked just as stated. Easy to use and set up. Would have had 5 stars if the remote would have been easier to open, literally needed to google it so I could get the batteries in
author: tracy harrison

review: I was looking for an Android HDMI stick I could use on any of my TV's for watching Netflix and side-loading Kodi (formerly XMBC). I bought an Android set top box for $100+ a year or so ago and this does basically the same thing for much less money. The remote is pretty simple, with no keyboard, which makes entering text kind of a pain, but downloading the Android application to my phone solved that.
